column2: IX
column3: IX

column2: THERE was a curious social situation in Black Hawk.
column3: THERE was a curious social situation in Black Hawk.

column2: All the young men felt the attraction of the fine, well-set-up country girls who had come to town to earn a living, and, in nearly every case, to help the father struggle out of debt, or to make it possible for the younger children of the family to go to school.
column3: All the young men felt the attraction of the fine, well set-up country girls who had come to town to earn a living, and, in nearly every case, to help the father struggle out of debt, or to make it possible for the younger children of the family to go to school.

column2: Those girls had grown up in the first bitter-hard times, and had got little schooling themselves.
column3: Those girls had grown up in the first bitter hard times, and had got little schooling themselves.

column2: But the younger brothers and sisters, for whom they made such sacrifices and who have had "advantages," never seem to me, when I meet them now, half as interesting or as well educated.
column3: But the younger brothers and sisters, for whom they made such sacrifices and who have had "advantages," never seem to me, when I meet them now, half as interesting or as well educated.

column2: The older girls, who helped to break up the wild sod, learned so much from life, from poverty, from their mothers and grandmothers; they had all, like Antonia, been early awakened and made observant by coming at a tender age from an old country to a new.
column3: The older girls, who helped to break up the wild sod, learned so much from life, from poverty, from their mothers and grandmothers; they had all, like Antonia, been early awakened and made observant by coming at a tender age from an old country to a new.

column2: I can remember a score of these country girls who were in service in Black Hawk during the few years I lived there, and I can remember something unusual and engaging about each of them.
column3: I can remember a score of these country girls who were in service in Black Hawk during the few years I lived there, and I can remember something unusual and engaging about each of them.

column2: Physically they were almost a race apart, and out-of-door work had given them a vigor which, when they got over their first shyness on coming to town, developed into a positive carriage and freedom of movement, and made them conspicuous among Black Hawk women.
column3: Physically they were almost a race apart, and out of door work had given them a vigor which, when they got over their first shyness on coming to town, developed into a positive carriage and freedom of movement, and made them conspicuous among Black Hawk women.

column2: That was before the day of High-School athletics.
column3: That was before the day of high-school athletics.

column2: Girls who had to walk more than half a mile to school were pitied.
column3: Girls who had to walk more than half a mile to school were pitied.

column2: There was not a tennis court in the town; physical exercise was thought rather inelegant for the daughters of well-to-do families.
column3: There was not a tennis court in the town; physical exercise was thought rather inelegant for the daughters of well to do families.

column2: Some of the High-School girls were jolly and pretty, but they stayed indoors in winter because of the cold, and in summer because of the heat.
column3: Some of the high-school girls were jolly and pretty, but they stayed indoors in winter because of the cold, and in summer because of the heat.

column2: When one danced with them their bodies never moved inside their clothes; their muscles seemed to ask but one thing--not to be disturbed.
column3: When one danced with them their bodies never moved inside their clothes; their muscles seemed to ask but one thing-not to be disturbed.

column2: I remember those girls merely as faces in the schoolroom, gay and rosy, or listless and dull, cut off below the shoulders, like cherubs, by the ink-smeared tops of the high desks that were surely put there to make us round-shouldered and hollow-chested.
column3: I remember those girls merely as faces in the schoolroom, gay and rosy, or listless and dull, cut off below the shoulders, like cherubs, by the ink smeared tops of the high desks that were surely put there to make us round shouldered and hollow chested.

column2: The daughters of Black Hawk merchants had a confident, uninquiring belief that they were "refined," and that the country girls, who "worked out," were not.
column3: The daughters of Black Hawk merchants had a confident, uninquiring belief that they were "refined," and that the country girls, who "worked out," were not.

column2: The American farmers in our county were quite as hard-pressed as their neighbors from other countries.
column3: The American farmers in our county were quite as hard pressed as their neighbors from other countries.

column2: All alike had come to Nebraska with little capital and no knowledge of the soil they must subdue.
column3: All alike had come to Nebraska with little capital and no knowledge of the soil they must subdue.

column2: All had borrowed money on their land.
column3: All had borrowed money on their land.

column2: But no matter in what straits the Pennsylvanian or Virginian found himself, he would not let his daughters go out into service.
column3: But no matter in what straits the Pennsylvanian or Virginian found himself, he would not let his daughters go out into service.

column2: Unless his girls could teach a country school, they sat at home in poverty.
column3: Unless his girls could teach a country school, they sat at home in poverty.

column2: The Bohemian and Scandinavian girls could not get positions as teachers, because they had had no opportunity to learn the language.
column3: The Bohemian and Scandinavian girls could not get positions as teachers, because they had had no opportunity to learn the language.

column2: Determined to help in the struggle to clear the homestead from debt, they had no alternative but to go into service.
column3: Determined to help in the struggle to clear the homestead from debt, they had no alternative but to go into service.

column2: Some of them, after they came to town, remained as serious and as discreet in behavior as they had been when they ploughed and herded on their father's farm.
column3: Some of them, after they came to town, remained as serious and as discreet in behavior as they had been when they ploughed and herded on their father's farm.

column2: Others, like the three Bohemian Marys, tried to make up for the years of youth they had lost.
column3: Others, like the three Bohemian Marys, tried to make up for the years of youth they had lost.

column2: But every one of them did what she had set out to do, and sent home those hard-earned dollars.
column3: But every one of them did what she had set out to do, and sent home those hard earned dollars.

column2: The girls I knew were always helping to pay for ploughs and reapers, brood-sows, or steers to fatten.
column3: The girls I knew were always helping to pay for ploughs and reapers, brood sows, or steers to fatten.

column2: One result of this family solidarity was that the foreign farmers in our county were the first to become prosperous.
column3: One result of this family solidarity was that the foreign farmers in our county were the first to become prosperous.

column2: After the fathers were out of debt, the daughters married the sons of neighbors,--usually of like nationality,--and the girls who once worked in Black Hawk kitchens are to-day managing big farms and fine families of their own; their children are better off than the children of the town women they used to serve.
column3: After the fathers were out of debt, the daughters married the sons of neighbors,--usually of like nationality,--and the girls who once worked in Black Hawk kitchens are to day managing big farms and fine families of their own; their children are better off than the children of the town women they used to serve.

column2: I thought the attitude of the town people toward these girls very stupid. If I told my schoolmates that Lena Lingard's grandfather was a clergyman, and much respected in Norway, they looked at me blankly.
column3: I thought the attitude of the town people toward these girls very stupid. If I told my schoolmates that Lena Lingard's grandfather was a clergyman, and much respected in Norway, they looked at me blankly.

column2: What did it matter?
column3: What did it matter?

column2: All foreigners were ignorant people who could n't speak English. There was not a man in Black Hawk who had the intelligence or cultivation, much less the personal distinction, of Antonia's father.
column3: All foreigners were ignorant people who could n't speak English. There was not a man in Black Hawk who had the intelligence or cultivation, much less the personal distinction, of Antonia's father.

column2: Yet people saw no difference between her and the three Marys; they were all Bohemians, all "hired girls."
column3: Yet people saw no difference between her and the three Marys; they were all Bohemians, all "hired girls."

column2: I always knew I should live long enough to see my country girls come into their own, and I have.
column3: I always knew I should live long enough to see my country girls come into their own, and I have.

column2: To-day the best that a harassed Black Hawk merchant can hope for is to sell provisions and farm machinery and automobiles to the rich farms where that first crop of stalwart Bohemian and Scandinavian girls are now the mistresses.
column3: To day the best that a harassed Black Hawk merchant can hope for is to sell provisions and farm machinery and automobiles to the rich farms where that first crop of stalwart Bohemian and Scandinavian girls are now the mistresses.

column2: The Black Hawk boys looked forward to marrying Black Hawk girls, and living in a brand-new little house with best chairs that must not be sat upon, and hand-painted china that must not be used.
column3: The Black Hawk boys looked forward to marrying Black Hawk girls, and living in a brand new little house with best chairs that must not be sat upon, and hand painted china that must not be used.

column2: But sometimes a young fellow would look up from his ledger, or out through the grating of his father's bank, and let his eyes follow Lena Lingard, as she passed the window with her slow, undulating walk, or Tiny Soderball, tripping by in her short skirt and striped stockings.
column3: But sometimes a young fellow would look up from his ledger, or out through the grating of his father's bank, and let his eyes follow Lena Lingard, as she passed the window with her slow, undulating walk, or Tiny Soderball, tripping by in her short skirt and striped stockings.

column2: The country girls were considered a menace to the social order.
column3: The country girls were considered a menace to the social order.

column2: Their beauty shone out too boldly against a conventional background.
column3: Their beauty shone out too boldly against a conventional background.

column2: But anxious mothers need have felt no alarm.
column3: But anxious mothers need have felt no alarm.

column2: They mistook the mettle of their sons. The respect for respectability was stronger than any desire in Black Hawk youth.
column3: They mistook the mettle of their sons. The respect for respectability was stronger than any desire in Black Hawk youth.

column2: Our young man of position was like the son of a royal house; the boy who swept out his office or drove his delivery wagon might frolic with the jolly country girls, but he himself must sit all evening in a plush parlor where conversation dragged so perceptibly that the father often came in and made blundering efforts to warm up the atmosphere.
column3: Our young man of position was like the son of a royal house; the boy who swept out his office or drove his delivery wagon might frolic with the jolly country girls, but he himself must sit all evening in a plush parlor where conversation dragged so perceptibly that the father often came in and made blundering efforts to warm up the atmosphere.

column2: On his way home from his dull call, he would perhaps meet Tony and Lena, coming along the sidewalk whispering to each other, or the three Bohemian Marys in their long plush coats and caps, comporting themselves with a dignity that only made their eventful histories the more piquant.
column3: On his way home from his dull call, he would perhaps meet Tony and Lena, coming along the sidewalk whispering to each other, or the three Bohemian Marys in their long plush coats and caps, comporting themselves with a dignity that only made their eventful histories the more piquant.

column2: If he went to the hotel to see a traveling man on business, there was Tiny, arching her shoulders at him like a kitten.
column3: If he went to the hotel to see a traveling man on business, there was Tiny, arching her shoulders at him like a kitten.

column2: If he went into the laundry to get his collars, there were the four Danish girls, smiling up from their ironing-boards, with their white throats and their pink cheeks.
column3: If he went into the laundry to get his collars, there were the four Danish girls, smiling up from their ironing boards, with their white throats and their pink cheeks.

column2: The three Marys were the heroines of a cycle of scandalous stories, which the old men were fond of relating as they sat about the cigar-stand in the drug-store.
column3: The three Marys were the heroines of a cycle of scandalous stories, which the old men were fond of relating as they sat about the cigar stand in the drug store.

column2: Mary Dusak had been housekeeper for a bachelor rancher from Boston, and after several years in his service she was forced to retire from the world for a short time.
column3: Mary Dusak had been housekeeper for a bachelor rancher from Boston, and after several years in his service she was forced to retire from the world for a short time.

column2: Later she came back to town to take the place of her friend, Mary Svoboda, who was similarly embarrassed.
column3: Later she came back to town to take the place of her friend, Mary Svoboda, who was similarly embarrassed.

column2: The three Marys were considered as dangerous as high explosives to have about the kitchen, yet they were such good cooks and such admirable housekeepers that they never had to look for a place.
column3: The three Marys were considered as dangerous as high explosives to have about the kitchen, yet they were such good cooks and such admirable housekeepers that they never had to look for a place.

column2: The Vannis' tent brought the town boys and the country girls together on neutral ground.
column3: The Vannis' tent brought the town boys and the country girls together on neutral ground.

column2: Sylvester Lovett, who was cashier in his father's bank, always found his way to the tent on Saturday night.
column3: Sylvester Lovett, who was cashier in his father's bank, always found his way to the tent on Saturday night.

column2: He took all the dances Lena Lingard would give him, and even grew bold enough to walk home with her.
column3: He took all the dances Lena Lingard would give him, and even grew bold enough to walk home with her.

column2: If his sisters or their friends happened to be among the onlookers on "popular nights," Sylvester stood back in the shadow under the cottonwood trees, smoking and watching Lena with a harassed expression.
column3: If his sisters or their friends happened to be among the onlookers on "popular nights," Sylvester stood back in the shadow under the cottonwood trees, smoking and watching Lena with a harassed expression.

column2: Several times I stumbled upon him there in the dark, and I felt rather sorry for him.
column3: Several times I stumbled upon him there in the dark, and I felt rather sorry for him.

column2: He reminded me of Ole Benson, who used to sit on the draw-side and watch Lena herd her cattle.
column3: He reminded me of Ole Benson, who used to sit on the draw side and watch Lena herd her cattle.

column2: Later in the summer, when Lena went home for a week to visit her mother, I heard from Antonia that young Lovett drove all the way out there to see her, and took her buggy-riding.
column3: Later in the summer, when Lena went home for a week to visit her mother, I heard from Antonia that young Lovett drove all the way out there to see her, and took her buggy riding.

column2: In my ingenuousness I hoped that Sylvester would marry Lena, and thus give all the country girls a better position in the town.
column3: In my ingenuousness I hoped that Sylvester would marry Lena, and thus give all the country girls a better position in the town.

column2: Sylvester dallied about Lena until he began to make mistakes in his work; had to stay at the bank until after dark to make his books balance.
column3: Sylvester dallied about Lena until he began to make mistakes in his work; had to stay at the bank until after dark to make his books balance.

column2: He was daft about her, and every one knew it.
column3: He was daft about her, and every one knew it.

column2: To escape from his predicament he ran away with a widow six years older than himself, who owned a half-section.
column3: To escape from his predicament he ran away with a widow six years older than himself, who owned a half section.

column2: This remedy worked, apparently.
column3: This remedy worked, apparently.

column2: He never looked at Lena again, nor lifted his eyes as he ceremoniously tipped his hat when he happened to meet her on the sidewalk.
column3: He never looked at Lena again, nor lifted his eyes as he ceremoniously tipped his hat when he happened to meet her on the sidewalk.

column2: So that was what they were like, I thought, these white-handed, high-collared clerks and bookkeepers!
column3: So that was what they were like, I thought, these white handed, high collared clerks and bookkeepers!

column2: I used to glare at young Lovett from a distance and only wished I had some way of showing my contempt for him.
column3: I used to glare at young Lovett from a distance and only wished I had some way of showing my contempt for him.

column3: X

column2: IT was at the Vannis' tent that Antonia was discovered.
column3: i t was at the Vannis' tent that Antonia was discovered.

column2: Hitherto she had been looked upon more as a ward of the Harlings than as one of the "hired girls." She had lived in their house and yard and garden; her thoughts never seemed to stray outside that little kingdom.
column3: Hitherto she had been looked upon more as a ward of the Harlings than as one of the "hired girls." She had lived in their house and yard and garden; her thoughts never seemed to stray outside that little kingdom.

column2: But after the tent came to town she began to go about with Tiny and Lena and their friends.
column3: But after the tent came to town she began to go about with Tiny and Lena and their friends.

column2: The Vannis often said that Antonia was the best dancer of them all.
column3: The Vannis often said that Antonia was the best dancer of them all.

column2: I sometimes heard murmurs in the crowd outside the pavilion that Mrs. Harling would soon have her hands full with that girl.
column3: I sometimes heard murmurs in the crowd outside the pavilion that mrs Harling would soon have her hands full with that girl.

column2: The young men began to joke with each other about "the Harlings' Tony" as they did about "the Marshalls' Anna" or "the Gardeners' Tiny."
column3: The young men began to joke with each other about "the Harlings' Tony" as they did about "the Marshalls' Anna" or "the Gardeners' Tiny."
